<style>
:root {
  --theme-main: #2b864b;
  --theme-bg: #f5f6fa;
  --theme-card-bg: #fff;
  --theme-card-shadow: 0 2px 10px rgba(43,134,75,0.10);
  --theme-border: #e3e7ed;
}

body {
  background: var(--theme-bg);
  margin: 0;
  min-height: 100vh;
}

.header-section {
  font-size: 2.6rem;
  font-weight: 700;
  color: #2b864b;
  margin-bottom: 1.1rem;
  letter-spacing: -0.5px;
}

.member-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 320px 800px;
  grid-template-rows: auto;
  gap: 1rem;
}

.member-grid-item {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  justify-content: flex-start;
  background: var(--theme-card-bg);
  border-radius: 10px;
  box-shadow: var(--theme-card-shadow);
  border: 1.5px solid var(--theme-border);
  padding: 1rem;
  text-align: center;
  transition: transform 0.13s, box-shadow 0.13s;
  cursor: pointer;
  height: 500px; 
  min-width: 200px;
  max-width: 320px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.member-grid-item:hover {
  transform: translateY(-5px) scale(1.025);
  box-shadow: 0 8px 32px rgba(43,134,75,0.15);
  border-color: var(--theme-main);
}

.profile-link {
  display: contents;
  text-decoration: none;
  color: inherit;
  height: 100%;
}

.member-grid-image {
  width: 158px;
  height: 158px;
  object-fit: cover;
  border-radius: 50%;
  margin: 0.5rem auto 0.8rem auto;
  border: 3px solid var(--theme-main);
  background: #d5f5e3;
  box-shadow: 0 1px 6px rgba(43,134,75,0.12);
  flex-shrink: 0;
}

.member-grid-title {
  font-size: 1.1rem;
  color: #70877c;
  margin-bottom: 0.5rem;
  font-weight: 600;
}

.member-grid-position {
  font-size: 1.2rem;
  color: var(--theme-main);
  margin-bottom: 0.5rem;
  font-weight: 600;
  text-transform: uppercase;
}

.member-grid-name {
  font-size: 1.3rem;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: #212c2b;
  margin-bottom: 0.3rem;
  line-height: 1.4;
  min-height: 3em;
  max-height: 3em;
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  text-align: center;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.member-grid-org {
  font-size: 1.1rem;
  color: #45695f;
  margin-bottom: 0.2rem;
}

.member-grid-faculty {
  font-size: 1.1rem;
  color: #70877c;
  margin-bottom: 0.2rem;
}

.member-socials {
  margin-top: auto;
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  gap: 0.5rem;
  padding-top: 1rem;
}

.social-link {
  display: inline-flex;         
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  background: none;              
  box-shadow: none;               
  color: #2b864b;                 
  text-decoration: none;
  font-size: 1.4rem;              
  width: auto;                  
  height: auto;                 
  border: none;                  
  border-radius: 0;              
  padding: 0;                   
  cursor: pointer;
  transition: color 0.2s;
}

.social-link i {
  display: block; 
  line-height: 1;      
  margin: 0; 
  vertical-align: middle; 
  font-size: 1.2rem;
}

.social-link:hover {
  background-color: #BEE3F8;
  color: white;
  transform: translateY(-2px);
}

.description-text {
  font-size: 1.2rem;
  color: #4a5568;
  line-height: 1.85;
  margin-top: 0;
  margin-bottom: 0.5rem;
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
}

.read-more-btn {
  margin-top: 0.5rem;
  align-self: flex-start;
  display: inline-block;
  padding: 0.4em 1.1em;
  background: var(--theme-main);
  color: #fff !important;
  border-radius: 5px;
  font-size: 1rem;
  font-weight: 500;
  text-decoration: none !important;
  box-shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(43,134,75,0.08);
  transition: background 0.13s, box-shadow 0.13s;
  border: none;
  cursor: pointer;
}

.read-more-btn:hover {
  background: #256b3e;
  color: #fff !important;
}

hr {
    border: 0;
    height: 2px;
    background-image: linear-gradient(to right, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5), rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.9), rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5));
    margin: 20px 0;
    grid-column: 1 / -1; 
  }

        <p>
            Malika Ihle is the LMU Open Science Center Coordinator, supporting the scientific board in developing a comprehensive approach to open research that extends across all disciplines, using both bottom-up and top-down strategies. Her role is to provide peer-to-peer training and develop an open research curriculum, coordinate grassroots initiatives and organise various events such as seminars and conferences, support meta-research collaborations, liaise with local, national (e.g. the German Reproducibility Network (GRN)), and international stakeholders to inform the design of incentives and policies, and co-develop a strategic plan to make the LMU Open Science Center a sustainable entity.

        <p>
          Sarah von Grebmer zu Wolfsthurn is one of the two Open Science coordinators at the LMU Open Science Centre (OSC). She coordinates the “Train-the-trainer” programme. She is involved in:
          Coordinating, developing and delivering the "Train-the-Trainer" program at LMU to train future Open Science ambassadors and Open Science trainers
          Collaborating with the other scientific coordinator to develop and deliver a "Switch-to-Open" program
          Facilitating interdisciplinary workshops, seminars, and networking events to engage and support participants in adopting open research practices.
          Before her work at the LMU Open Science Centre, Sarah was a Marie Skłodowska-Curie PhD Fellow within the Horizon2020 programme at Leiden University (NL). She has a PhD in Cognitive Psychology and Neurolinguistics and was a lecturer in experimental methods and psycho- and neurolinguistics during and after her PhD at Leiden University.
